column3: March 15 Northrop Grumman Corp's  bid to build a new U.S. bomber appears to have won the multibillion-dollar competition solely on the basis of cost
column4: said a top executive with Lockheed Martin Corp
column5: whose team led by Boeing Co lost the bidding.

column2: UPDATE 2-Lockheed CEO still likes Sikorsky despite slumping sales to energy sector WASHINGTON
column3: March 15 Lockheed Martin Corp  has "no regrets" about buying Sikorsky for $9 billion even though sliding oil prices have taken a bigger bite than expected from the company's commercial helicopter sales
column4: Chief Executive Marillyn Hewson said Tuesday.
